Question
========

We draw a random sample among 2,500 adults. Suppose X is the number of people in the sample living unmarried with a partner. The probability that at least 1/5 of this sample is unmarried cohabiting can be written as:

Answerlist
----------

* P (X≥1/5).
* P (X≤500).
* P (X≥500).
* P (X≤ 2000).
* P (X≤ 2500).

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P (X≥1/5)...: Incorrect
* P (X≤ 500)..: Incorrect
* P (X≥500): Correct
* P (X≤ 2000)..: Incorrect
* P (X≤ 2500)..: Incorrect
